name: MAPREDUCE
comment: This is comment for MAPREDUCE service

properties.name: io.sort.record.percent
properties.description: No description

properties.name: io.sort.factor
properties.description: No description

properties.name: mapred.tasktracker.tasks.sleeptime-before-sigkill
properties.description:
Normally, this is the amount of time before killing
  processes, and the recommended-default is 5.000 seconds - a value of
  5000 here.  In this case, we are using it solely to blast tasks before
  killing them, and killing them very quickly (1/4 second) to guarantee
  that we do not leave VMs around for later jobs.

properties.name: mapred.job.tracker.handler.count
properties.description:
The number of server threads for the JobTracker. This should be roughly
    4% of the number of tasktracker nodes.

properties.name: mapred.reduce.parallel.copies
properties.description: No description

properties.name: mapred.map.tasks.speculative.execution
properties.description:
If true, then multiple instances of some map tasks
               may be executed in parallel.

properties.name: mapred.reduce.tasks.speculative.execution
properties.description:
If true, then multiple instances of some reduce tasks
               may be executed in parallel.

properties.name: mapred.inmem.merge.threshold
properties.description:
The threshold, in terms of the number of files
  for the in-memory merge process. When we accumulate threshold number of files
  we initiate the in-memory merge and spill to disk. A value of 0 or less than
  0 indicates we want to DON'T have any threshold and instead depend only on
  the ramfs's memory consumption to trigger the merge.

properties.name: mapred.job.shuffle.merge.percent
properties.description:
The usage threshold at which an in-memory merge will be
  initiated, expressed as a percentage of the total memory allocated to
  storing in-memory map outputs, as defined by
  mapred.job.shuffle.input.buffer.percent.

properties.name: mapred.job.shuffle.input.buffer.percent
properties.description:
The percentage of memory to be allocated from the maximum heap
  size to storing map outputs during the shuffle.

properties.name: mapred.output.compression.type
properties.description:
If the job outputs are to compressed as SequenceFiles, how should
               they be compressed? Should be one of NONE, RECORD or BLOCK.

properties.name: mapred.jobtracker.restart.recover
properties.description:
"true" to enable (job) recovery upon restart,
               "false" to start afresh

properties.name: mapred.job.reduce.input.buffer.percent
properties.description:
The percentage of memory- relative to the maximum heap size- to
  retain map outputs during the reduce. When the shuffle is concluded, any
  remaining map outputs in memory must consume less than this threshold before
  the reduce can begin.

properties.name: mapreduce.reduce.input.limit
properties.description:
The limit on the input size of the reduce. (This value
  is 10 Gb.)  If the estimated input size of the reduce is greater than
  this value, job is failed. A value of -1 means that there is no limit
  set.

properties.name: mapred.task.timeout
properties.description:
The number of milliseconds before a task will be
  terminated if it neither reads an input, writes an output, nor
  updates its status string.

properties.name: jetty.connector
properties.description: No description

properties.name: mapred.max.tracker.blacklists
properties.description: if node is reported blacklisted by 16 successful jobs within timeout-window, it will be graylisted

properties.name: mapred.job.tracker.persist.jobstatus.active
properties.description:
Indicates if persistency of job status information is
  active or not.

properties.name: mapred.job.tracker.persist.jobstatus.hours
properties.description:
The number of hours job status information is persisted in DFS.
    The job status information will be available after it drops of the memory
    queue and between jobtracker restarts. With a zero value the job status
    information is not persisted at all in DFS.

properties.name: mapred.job.tracker.history.completed.location
properties.description: No description

properties.name: mapred.job.reuse.jvm.num.tasks
properties.description: How many tasks to run per jvm. If set to -1, there is no limit

properties.name: mapreduce.jobtracker.staging.root.dir
properties.description:
The Path prefix for where the staging directories should be placed. The next level is always the user's
   name. It is a path in the default file system.

properties.name: mapreduce.tasktracker.group
properties.description: The group that the task controller uses for accessing the task controller. The mapred user must be a member and users should *not* be members.

properties.name: mapreduce.jobtracker.split.metainfo.maxsize
properties.description:
If the size of the split metainfo file is larger than this, the JobTracker will fail the job during
    initialize.

properties.name: mapreduce.history.server.embedded
properties.description:
Should job history server be embedded within Job tracker
process

properties.name: mapred.jobtracker.blacklist.fault-timeout-window
properties.description: 3-hour sliding window (value is in minutes)

properties.name: mapred.jobtracker.blacklist.fault-bucket-width
properties.description: 15-minute bucket size (value is in minutes)

properties.name: mapred.queue.names
properties.description: Comma separated list of queues configured for this jobtracker.
